1.title: CTS Redux
1.plot: Interviews with West Virginia personalities (two guests and one musical guest) discussing their careers and how having ties to the state of West Virginia impacted their lives.

1.title: Premiere
1.plot: CTS Host Michael Perri sits down with guests John Kruk, Bobby Ray Shafer and The Davission Brothers Band (as well as an interview with the group) and discusses themselves, their families, career and their ties to the state of West Virginia.

2.title: Part II
2.plot: In this episode CTS Host Michael Perri sits down with guests; Actress Joyce DeWitt, Two-time World of Outlaws Champion Josh Richards and the Legendary Jimi Hendrix Bassist Billy Cox (Plus The New Band of Gypsies perform) to discuss themselves, their families, career and their ties to the state of West Virginia.

imdb.plot outline: Michael Perri, host, sits down with well-known and up and coming personalities each who have ties to the state of West Virginia. Featuring the music of Fletcher's Grove, Michael interviews each guest and discusses their careers, life experiences and how having family or connections to West Virginia impacted their lives. With a hint of comedy and lots of surprises each episode is designed to inform, encourage and inspire its audience.
imdb.title: The Coffee Talk Show
plot: Talk show featuring a variety of guests including; business professionals, musicians, actors, actresses, up and coming stars and more.::Michael D Perri

Michael Perri, host, sits down with well-known and up and coming personalities each who have ties to the state of West Virginia. Featuring the music of Fletcher's Grove, Michael interviews each guest and discusses their careers, life experiences and how having family or connections to West Virginia impacted their lives. With a hint of comedy and lots of surprises each episode is designed to inform, encourage and inspire its audience.::Michael D Perri
synopsis: Do you have a stereotype of West Virginia? Do you think we are just a bunch of redneck, hillbillies who carry guns and yell "Yeeeehaaaw!" You are sadly mistaken. There is much more to this "Almost Heaven" Mountain State. Home to brilliant minds like John Nash (his true story portrayed in "A Beautiful Mind" starring Russell Crowe), music legend Bill Withers (Lean On Me), long-time comedic actor Don Knotts (Barney Fife himself), sports icon Jerry West (The NBA logo) and The Discovery Channel Founder and businessman extraordinaire John Hendricks. We have mountains and valleys and more then you realize. So "Take a sip of what we're brew'n!" at The Coffee Talk Show (a production of The Cuppa Joe Foundation). Interviews, music and lots of fun with celebrity guests and up and comers who have ties to the great state of West Virginia. We think you'll find, what all of us Mountaineers already know, we are filled with talented, amazing and iconic people.
